decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By utilizing cards like Galvanic Discharge, Goblin Bombardment, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck can also deal direct damage to the opponent and control the board. The main strategy is to maintain a fast pace and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck utilizes the powerful UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for the cast of big Eldrazi threats such as Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny. Karn, the Great Creator helps shut down opponent's artifacts while also providing a win condition with its ability to fetch powerful artifacts from the sideboard. Ugin, Eye of the Storms and All Is Dust provide board wipes to control the battlefield, while cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Sire of Seven Deaths offer removal and disruption to keep opponents in check.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive tactics to quickly overwhelm opponents with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Voice of Victory. Utilizing cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for removal and damage spells, this deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer powerful creature buffs and support. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and support spells, this deck aims to maintain pressure on opponents and secure victories in a fast-paced, aggressive manner.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The key strategy is to establish early pressure with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while using cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge to clear the opponent's board and finish them off. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional support and boost the aggression of the deck. The deck also includes protective measures like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to control the battlefield and ensure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply pressure early on, while also including support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer for additional value and card advantage. The inclusion of Static Prison and Arena of Glory helps to control the board and protect your creatures, creating a fast-paced and explosive playstyle aimed at securing a quick victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells and disruptive enchantments to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls provide early aggression, while cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah offer powerful finishers. The deck also utilizes control elements like Static Prison and Arena of Glory to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is meant to apply constant pressure and end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Reprieve and Ephemerate to protect your creatures, combined with powerful enchantments like Witch Enchanter and Ocelot Pride, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and control. By utilizing cards like Recruiter of the Guard and Kozilek's Command to search for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in order to secure victory.

The main concept of this Death and Taxes aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also ramping up your own board presence with creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to gain additional value from enter-the-battlefield abilities. Additionally, cards like Relic of Progenitus help to disrupt graveyard strategies. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and control the game through disruption and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this Affinity Aggro deck is to flood the board with cheap artifacts, using cards like Memnite and Ornithopter, and then utilize cards like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to buff up those creatures and go for a quick and aggressive win. The deck also focuses on generating mana efficiently through cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, in addition to card draw and filtering with Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. Urza's Saga enchantment can help search for key artifacts like Cranial Plating or Darksteel Citadel to further enhance the deck's aggro strategy.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Whir of Invention to find key pieces like Thundertrap Trainer, Lotus Bloom, and Goblin Charbelcher. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana quickly and use it to deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption spells like Disrupting Shoal and Flare of Denial to protect the combo pieces and control the board until the combo can be assembled. Overall, the deck revolves around a fast and efficient win condition without relying on traditional land cards.

This Aggro-Affinity deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifacts like  Ornithopter and Memnite while generating card advantage with cards like Thoughtcast and Thought Monitor. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary, while also utilizing powerful artifacts like Cranial Plating and Urza's Saga to further strengthen its board presence. The inclusion of utility cards like Tormod's Crypt and Metallic Rebuke helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a fast and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on using various instant reanimation spells and creatures with powerful abilities to quickly assemble a game-winning combo. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, the deck aims to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand to the battlefield, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Force of Negation. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Prismatic Ending to control the board. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they can effectively respond.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Spell Snare, and Counterspell to maintain control of the game, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Cling to Dust. The deck also includes a win condition in Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, a powerful threat that can take over the game if left unchecked.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Quantum Riddler. The deck also utilizes instant speed interaction with cards like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to protect the combo. By combining powerful reanimation spells with disruptive instants, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game in the early turns of the match.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill cards such as Tasha's Hideous Laughter, Fractured Sanity, and Archive Trap to force the opponent to draw and mill their cards quickly. Cards like Ruin Crab and Hedron Crab help accelerate the mill strategy, while control elements like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch provide removal and disruption. With the ability to quickly mill out the opponent's deck, the deck aims to win by depleting the opponent's library and winning the game through decking. The mana base is designed to support both blue and black requirements for the spells in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the pieces needed for a powerful combo win condition without relying on lands. Using cards like Whir of Invention and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to quickly ramp up to play key pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Tameshi, Reality Architect. Cards like Disrupting Shoal and Stern Scolding are used for disruption while Lotus Bloom helps with mana acceleration. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo before they have a chance to establish board presence.
